properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A heat event continues through the weekend into early next week. Inland from Lake Superior, daytime high temperatures near 29 degrees Celsius can be expected. Overnight lows will range from 16 to 20 degrees Celsius with the coolest temperatures again near Lake Superior. Cooler temperatures are forecast by next Tuesday. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-05T01:13:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T09:14:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1341914599.2020
Area: City of Thunder Bay, Cloud Bay - Dorion, Nipigon - Rossport, Marathon - Schreiber, Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Agawa - Lake Superior Park, Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:29 a.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This thunderstorms is tracking east across Lake Winnipegosis toward Skownan. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-04T15:28:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T12:30:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4207155413.2020
Area: Grand Rapids and Easterville, Waterhen Meadow Portage and Skownan

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 34 are expected for the next 2 days. A hot and humid airmass persists over much of east central Manitoba. Cooler temperatures will enter the area Sunday night. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. For more information on heat and your health: - Visit Manitoba Health at: http://www.manitoba.ca/health/publichealth/environmentalhealth/heat.html. - Call Health Links – Info Santé at 204-788-8200 or toll-free at 1-888-315-9257. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-05T02:00:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T10:01:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0847474210.2020

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Temperatures reaching 34 degrees Celsius combined with overnight lows near 18 degrees Celsius are expected for the next 5 days. A heat event will continue through the weekend into next week. Daytime high temperatures near 30 degrees Celsius with humidex values in the low to mid thirties are forecast over the next several days. Overnight lows will range from 18 to 20 degrees Celsius during this period. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-05T01:17:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T09:18:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3334338695.2020

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots, frequent lightning and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times. Thunderstorms stretching from near Duck Mountain Prov Park to Neepawa are moving east toward Lake Manitoba and Lake Winnipegosis this morning. These thunderstorms are capable of producing gusts in excess of 35 kts. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-07-04T16:14:34-00:00

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 37 are expected for the next 2 days. A long duration heat event will continue through the weekend. Relief is likely by Monday of next week. Daytime high temperatures in excess of 30 degrees Celsius, with humidex values in the mid thirties, are expected until Sunday. Overnight lows near 19 degrees Celsius will provide little relief from the heat. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

Daytime high temperatures in excess of 31 degrees Celsius, with humidex values in the high thirties to low forties, are expected for the foreseeable future. Overnight lows in excess of 21 degrees Celsius are also expected through this period, providing little relief from the heat. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions.
